qas.question: During the Migrations period Germans would encounter what groups in the east?
During the Migrations period Germans would encounter what group in the south?
The Limes Germanicus was breached in what year?
Who allied with the Germans after previous fighting them along side the Romans?
What leader had both prominent German and Hun families in his entourage throughout Europe?
When was the Limes Germanicus breached?
Who did the Germans come in contact with to the south?
Which Germanic tribe did the Huns cooperate with?
What language did the Huns adopt?
What happened to the Huns after Attila's death?

answers.text: either escaped into Asia, or otherwise blended in amongst Europeans

qas.question: During what period did the Germanic people have little contact with other people?
What was breached in the 2nd century AD?

plausible_answers.text: Huns disappearing as a people in Europe

qas.question: What happened to the Huns after the Roman Empire collapsed?
what part of Europe did the Huns conquer for Rome?

context: The Germanic peoples during the <b10_0>Migrations Period<b10_0/> came into contact with other peoples; in the case of the populations settling in the territory of modern Germany, they encountered <a1_0><a6_0>Celts<a6_0/><a1_0/> to the south, and <a0_0>Balts and Slavs<a0_0/> towards the east. The <b11_0>Limes Germanicus<b11_0/> was breached in <a2_0><a5_0>AD 260<a5_0/><a2_0/>. Migrating Germanic tribes commingled with the local Gallo-Roman populations in what is now Swabia and Bavaria. The arrival of the Huns in Europe resulted in Hun conquest of large parts of Eastern Europe, <a3_0>the Huns<a3_0/> initially were allies of the Roman Empire who fought against Germanic tribes, but later the Huns cooperated with the Germanic tribe of the <a7_0>Ostrogoths<a7_0/>, and large numbers of Germans lived within the lands of the Hunnic Empire of Attila. <a4_0>Attila<a4_0/> had both Hunnic and Germanic families and prominent Germanic chiefs amongst his close entourage in Europe. The Huns living in Germanic territories in <b13_0>Eastern Europe<b13_0/> adopted an <a8_0>East Germanic<a8_0/> language as their lingua franca. A major part of Attila's army were Germans, during the Huns' campaign against the Roman Empire. After Attila's unexpected death the Hunnic Empire collapsed with the <b12_0>Huns disappearing as a people in Europe<b12_0/> – who <a9_0>either escaped into Asia, or otherwise blended in amongst Europeans<a9_0/>.
